alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 1:21AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Lincoln and Sagadahoc. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 AM EST, Moderate to locally heavy rain will continue to cross the region during the overnight hours with one to one and a half inches already fallen. Minor flooding will begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, South Portland, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Bath, Gardiner, Alfred and Damariscotta.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; York
